page.title: 06RECREATION- games
page.content: THE GAMES WHICH CHILDREN PLAY IN THE PLAYGROUNDare numerous and varied. As this survey was carried out at Stamford Boys School the games are male orientated.These were the favourites: TIG-requires 3 or more players. One person is chosen to be 'it' and must try to touch the other players.Once you are tigged you must become 'it'. BRITISH BULLDOG- there are two people 'it' and two walls about 50 metres apart. You have to run to each wall without being tigged. Once tigged you join the two who are already 'it'. AKI AKI- One person is 'it' and counts to 100 whilst everybody hides. The people in hiding then have to get back to a predetermined 'home' (e.g. a bench), and the last person home without being tigged becomes the next 'it'
